The towels are great quality, beds are comfortable (although I wouldn't want to sleep in the bunk bed as an adult) and the kitchen is decently stocked.
It's a great house for adults or a family with older kids, but we probably wouldn't stay there again with a baby. We stayed for a week and were terrified our baby was going to fall down the stairs the whole time. There are gaps to the sides of the stairs so it would be worse than a fall down regular stairs. They did provide baby gates which we were grateful to find, but it was tricky to get a gate to stay in the right place. The bathtub is also peeling and paint got in our kids' hair, there are no plastic dishes and the yard is not great for kids.
I still give it 5 stars because it is a beautiful home and a really fun experience.

review_text:
Danette’s place was probably the best option in Gillette as far as we saw. We looked at many hotel reviews and a lot of them weren’t great (talked about bed bugs etc). Danette had some pretty decent reviews and is a super host so we thought we’d give it a shot.
Overall the pros were:
-Pretty easy checkout instructions which was nice.
-it was fairly cozy (kind of like a home away from home which was nice as well).
-loved the fact that there was a rocking chair (so I could rock my toddler to sleep, it made bedtime easier).
-the bathrooms were very clean
-it wasn’t too far away from some restaurants or stores or the freeway.
-I enjoyed the Christian decor. It was encouraging.
-it was homey.
-it was À fairly quiet neighborhood
Cons:
-the bed was very uncomfortable in the master. Both for my husband and I. We didn’t sleep in the second bedroom so I can’t speak for that. I think it may have been a better investment to provide a better quality mattress and maybe even a king size mattress because the room could absolutely accommodate that size.
-bedding and sheets were seemed pretty cheap (if that matters to you at all). Not the most comfortable to sleep under.
-the kitchen and entry was was dirty. There was some gunk that looked like food and mud on the floor that I could scrape off with my nail. Gross.
-the coffee maker was filthy, with residue all in the pot and also in the area where the filters go. One part of it looked a little moldy…
-there was a screw also found on the floor that my toddler could grabbed and put in her mouth or something- not safe or good at all. Not sure where it came from. But it made me wonder if the cleaners even vacuumed.
-there were crumbs in the counter so it seems that the cleaners really didn’t do a great job at all.
-when I brought this to the hosts attention, she asked what we’d like to have done for us and I just asked for the cleaning fee to be waived. I’m not sure if we have seen that yet or not. I’ll have to double check.
-not sure if it’s really a con but perhaps something for someone to know. The home is on a slight hill and is actually a duplex unit, which would have been nice to know ahead of time knowing that the parking may be a bit tight.
-it was FREEZING when we got in the house. I thought they keep the thermostat at 70 based on the checkout/check in instructions
-we were told the cleaner came almost a week prior to our arrival- so no wonder.
We only stayed for one night because we are moving halfway cross country. Overall it was decent- clean enough that there were no bugs or anything and the bed was clean. Sad we couldn’t use the coffee maker. Just too much to deal with and so after driving 7 hours with a toddler. I didn’t want to wash it out. It looked pretty gross. Like it hadn’t been washed for a while.
Overall we appreciated the stay. Maybe this was just a one off situation.
